title: Problem 2089_A
statement: Given an integer n. Construct a permutation p_1, p_2, ..., p_n of length n that satisfies the following property:For 1 ≤ i ≤ n, define c_i = \lceil \frac{p_1+p_2+... +p_i}{i} \rceil, then among c_1,c_2,...,c_n there must be at least \lfloor \frac{n}{3} \rfloor - 1 prime numbers.
